security_audit.summary: Simple Exa.ai API wrapper that reads only the EXA_API_KEY environment variable and makes outbound API calls to Exa.ai for search functionality. No filesystem access, no external command execution, and behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Finding accurate, up-to-date information online can be time-consuming. The Exa skill uses neural search technology to deliver high-quality, relevant web results through simple API calls.
actual_capabilities: Search the web using Exa.ai neural search API
Return search results as structured JSON output
Configure search with neural search type
limitations: Requires EXA_API_KEY environment variable to be set
No local caching or history of searches
Depends on external Exa.ai service availability

best_practices: Store your EXA_API_KEY securely in environment variables
Set EXA_API_KEY before running searches to avoid errors
Review search results for accuracy and relevance
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts or share them publicly
Do not make excessive searches that could exhaust API quotas
Do not rely on search results without verification

faq.question: Is Exa compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the Exa skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through standard API calls.

faq.question: How many results does each search return?
faq.answer: Default is 5 results. You can configure this parameter when making API calls.

faq.question: Can I use Exa with other search tools?
faq.answer: Yes, Exa can be combined with other skills for comprehensive research workflows.

faq.question: Is my search data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Search queries are sent to Exa.ai API. Review their privacy policy for data handling details.

faq.question: Why am I getting authentication errors?
faq.answer: Ensure EXA_API_KEY is set in your environment variables before running searches.

faq.question: How does Exa compare to regular search engines?
faq.answer: Exa uses neural search for more relevant results based on meaning rather than keywords.
